Gas Turbines.Description: Gas turbines are commonly powered by natural gas, which is burned to produce high-pressure gas that drives the turbine.
Gas turbines are used in power plants to generate electricity by converting the energy from burning fuel into mechanical energy and then into electrical energy.
Gas turbines, also known as jet engines, are used in aircraft to provide the necessary thrust for propulsion.
